subject: p10754184
History: Pancreatic cancer, on chemotherapy, Gemzar with increased shortness of breath. Evaluate.
Findings: A dual-lead pacemaker implanted in the left chest wall has two leads terminating in the expected location of the right atrium and right ventricle respectively. Mild hyperexpansion is unchanged. A small right pleural effusion is new. There are no focal opacities to suggest pneumonia. Mild cardiomegaly is stable. The hilar contours and pulmonary vasculature appear normal. The mediastinal silhouette is unchanged. Tortuosity of the thoracic aorta is re-demonstrated.
Impression: Small right pleural effusion is new however, there is no evidence of pneumonia and no other significant appreciable change. Mild cardiomegaly is unchanged. The above results were communicated via telephone by Dr. To Dr. At 2:45 pm. As requested.
